In the IRC channel <nowiki>[[irc:--irc.freenode.net-#ubuntu-ca]]</nowiki>.  Freenode Webchat at <nowiki>[[http://webchat.freenode.net/?channels=ubuntu-ca]]</nowiki>

<nowiki>[[log]]</nowiki>

== Minutes ==

* Introductions were held
** There are people here from FreeGeek!

* Ubuntu Hours
** <nowiki>[[psema4mobile]]</nowiki> and <nowiki>[[BobJonkman]]</nowiki> will be hosting an Ubuntu Hour in Hamilton in September
** <nowiki>[[chaslinux]]</nowiki> has started hosting Ubuntu Hours in Kitchener
** <nowiki>[[dscassel]]</nowiki> hosts an Ubuntu Hour next Wednesday in Waterloo 
** Ubuntu Hours an informal outreach, something to build community around 

* <nowiki>[[UbuntuGlobalJam|Ubuntu Global Jam]]</nowiki> coming up 2-4 September 2011 
** Kwartzlab is hosting an event; <nowiki>[[txwikinger]]</nowiki> plans to build automated packaging tool
** Bug fixes, bug triage, bug reporting, and Ubuntu Community Boosterism are all ways of contributing
** People expressed interest in participating through IRC or other collaborative software
** Kwartzlab will be paying attention to <nowiki>[[irc:--irc.freenode.net-#ubuntu-ca|#ubuntu-ca]]</nowiki> on IRC and broadcasting on <nowiki>[[http://www.ustream.tv/channel/kwartzlab|UStream]]</nowiki>
** Jams tend to be mostly self-directed, although Kwartzlab will be working on a project
** Other jams have focused on Unity testing, install testing

* <nowiki>[[http://sooncon.ca/wiki/Main_Page|SoOnCon 2011]]</nowiki> is on 1 October 2011 at Bell Lightbox in Toronto

* <nowiki>[[http://softwarefreedomday.org/|Software Freedom Day]]</nowiki> is Saturday, 17 September 2011
** Many <nowiki>[[http://wiki.softwarefreedomday.org/2011/Canada/|Canadian locations]]</nowiki> are participating

* Toronto LinuxFest is part of <nowiki>[[http://fsoss.senecac.on.ca/2011/|FSOSS]]</nowiki> this year, 27-29 October 2011
** Still looking for people to speak at LinuxFest! 
** There will be an unconference on the last day; breakout time for workshops and conferences

* Oneiric Ocelot releases on 13 October 2011
** Kwartzlab is hosting an Ubuntu Release Party on Saturday, 15 October 2011
** Release parties are easy to arrange:
** Find a place
** Invite people
** Burn some CDs of the new ISOs
** or just hang out

* <nowiki>[[https://events.linuxfoundation.org/events/linuxcon|LinuxCon NA]]</nowiki> is being held in Vancouver, 17-19 August 2011

* <nowiki>[[http://fosslc.org/drupal/sc2011|FOSSLC]]</nowiki> is hosting a conference in Ottawa on 27 August 2011
